title: Java vs Bedrock, why is bedrock so much better?
self_text: I have been playing Minecraft for years now and I finally made the switch to bedrock, i am never going back! There are so many benefits of bedrock over java edition that it's not even a competition anymore. You can play with anyone on any platform and its just generally more optimized and runs way better than java ever could.

title: I just found a new way to get xp on bedrock (PS4)
self_text: So, if you have a hopper and some lava in your base, you can do this! Put the hopper under a slab, then fill it with any item, and start mining the block above it. It will give you xp when the items break through the slab. This works for every block that drops an item!  I hope this helps others! :)

title: I just found the best way to get a good fishing rod!
self_text: You can make it in survival mode by getting an enchanted book from a villager with lure, luck of the sea and mending. Then you use an anvil and put it on your fishing rod.

title: Bedrock/java parity
self_text:
I was thinking about how to make bedrock and java more similar, here's what i think would be a good start;  
*   more blocks that are the same 
*   better redstone (it's really bad on bedrock) 
*   the ability to change render distance 
*   a way to get custom maps onto bedrock easier 
what do you guys think?
